p: Dr Maini elaborated how multiple mechanisms are at play to constrain HBV-specific T cells. These include the high quantity of antigenic peptides and duration of exposure to antigen load, the up-regulation of multiple co-inhibitory receptors (including PD-1, LAG-3, Tim-3 and CTLA-4), transcriptional, metabolic and epigenetic defects, negative regulation by NK cells and suppressive cytokines.
